(product details (categories or advertisers), vehicles and period).
You may therefore re-launch a search a query without re-entering parameters.

"The AdExpress website is best viewed with Internet Explorer (version 6.0). You can download this software from Microsoft's website: http://www.microsoft.fr."
The website may be accessed via a PC.

The site is best viewed with the screen resolution set to 1024 by 768 pixels. To modify the resolution, go to the Start menu, select Settings, then Control Panel and launch the Display Properties window. Click on the Settings tab to change the parameters.
Excel version 2000 is required to export the data.
"Acrobat Reader (version 6.0) is required to view tables in PDF format. You can download this software from Adobe's website: www.adobe.fr."
"Certain images on the site may require Macromedia Flash Player (version 7.0). You can download this software from Macromedia's website: www.macromedia.com."

"Audio and video advertisements can be accessed via Real One Player (version 2) or Windows Media Player (version 9). You can download this software from Real Networks' website: <a href=""http://www.france.real.com"" target=""blank"" class=""roll05"">www.france"

"There are two methods for selecting a product set:

   1. Search by keyword for product groups, classes, etc.
   2. Load a saved product working set."
Manual Search Function for Product Classification Items

Search by selecting your required product classification level and entering a keyword in the text box provided (minimum 2 characters).

AdExpress has identified the product items corresponding to your search parameters.

to confirm your current selection and complete the product selection process.
" Click on this icon to reset search parameters."

"1. To select all references represented by a particular advertiser, click on the corresponding advertiser heading. If you then save your selection, all new products from this particular advertiser will be taken into account."

"2. To select an advertiser and remove certain references from the selection, click on the corresponding advertiser heading, then roll out the full list of references by clicking on the double arrow to the right of the advertiser heading and deselect "

"3 To select only certain references, roll out the full list by clicking on the double arrow on the right of the advertiser heading and click on the corresponding check boxes. If you then save your selection, only the references you selected will be t"

"This method of selection also applies at other levels of the product classification system.

For each level selected, the level directly below can be viewed as follows:

to save your search for future use. You can also name your working set and designate a folder in which it should be stored. The folder ADEXPRESS exists by default. Should you wish to create other folders, go to My AdExpress.
Automatic Download of Saved Product Working set

"The ""My Working sets"" section enables you to reuse saved product sets. To load a working set, click on the double arrow icon located on the right-hand side of the page to bring up a list of available working sets. Make your choice and click on"

to validate.
You can order other elements to the loaded working set by using the search by keyword facility.
This icon enables you to view your parameters at any stage of the search. It is displayed when the first parameter is selected.
This icon enables you to reset the current product set and select new parameters.
This icon enables you to reset the current media set and select new parameters.
This icon enables you to reset your chosen time period and select new parameters.
This icon is displayed when the user modifies search parameters after viewing the results table. It enables you to reset the results table without modifying search parameters.

"To select a medium, click on the corresponding check box.

To select or deselect all media, click on the ""Select/Deselect all Media"" link above the list of media.

to confirm your current selection and complete the media selection process.

"There are two methods for selecting the required time period:

  1. Search by Calendar Period
  2. Search by Rolling Period
"

To select a calendar period, use the monthly and weekly calendars provided to choose a start date and an end date. The double arrow icons located on either side of the month heading enable you to skip backwards and forwards in time.
to confirm your current selection and complete the time period selection process. This type of period can be saved in My AdExpress but cannot be shifted over time.

"To define a rolling period, use the dropdown menus to select as follows:

  • t"
Previous period refers to that preceding the period that is currently active and available on the site.

  • the previous month,
  • the previous week.
or click the check box to make your selection
to confirm your current selection and complete the time period selection process. This type of period can be saved in My AdExpress and can be shifted over time.

This icon enables you to save your search. Click here to open a save menu window.
"You can name your working set and designate a particular folder in which to save it. The ""AdExpress"" folder exists by default. Should you wish to create other folders, go to ""My AdExpress""."
This icon enables you to display the media hierarchy in detail, down to vehicle level.
This icon enables you to close the media hierarchy back to sub media level.

Click on a main sub media heading to display sub-headings in detail, down to vehicle level. Click on the heading again to mask the sub-headings.

Click on a vehicle title to zoom in on its advertising activity. Click on the title again to display th

The calendar of advertising activity is set out by month or by week, depending on the search parameters. You can view the calendar in terms of individual days by clicking on the heading corresponding to the required month or week.
In zoom mode, the results are displayed by day over a given month or week. The double arrow icons on either side of the month and week headings enable you to move backwards and forwards in time.
The Creative column enables you to access both the creatives available and a list of insertions. You can access this option by clicking on the
corresponding to your required level (Medium / Sub media / Vehicle). You can then export lists of insertions (month by month or week by week) by clicking on

This colour represents a period of inactivity.

1. To select all items within a group, click on the corresponding group heading. If you then save your selection, all new sub groups added to the group will also be taken into account.

2. To select a group but remove certain sub groups, click on the corresponding group heading, roll out the group list by clicking on the double arrow icon and then deselect unwanted sub groups. To select or deselect all lsub groups in the group, simply cl

3. To select sub groups individually, roll out the full list by clicking on the double arrow icon on the right of the group heading and click on the corresponding check boxes. If you then save your selection, only the sub groups you selected will be taken

To select a calendar period, use the monthly calendar provided to choose a start date and an end date in the same calendar year. The double arrow icons located on either side of the month heading enable you to skip backwards and forwards in time.
If you wish to carry out a comparative study, check the corresponding box. The previous period will automatically be selected.

"The Creative column enables you to access both the creatives available and a list of insertions. You can access this option by clicking on the corresponding icon."
"The media schedule column enables you to access media schedules at different product classification levels, simply by clicking on the corresponding icon."
This table can be displayed showing only insets, including insets or excluding insets by selecting the required option in the following dropdown menu.

In Television and Radio, this key report enables you to view the list of spots per day for the relevant period.
In Press, this key report enables you to view the list of insertions included in each issue of the relevant publication(s).
In Press, this key report enables you to view adverts sorted by format, colour, position and insert.
In Television and Radio, this key report enables you to view all adverts sorted by time slot.

Click on this button to export the table of results as it is presented on-screen and print it.The table will then be copied into an Excel document, which will open automatically. All elements produced on-line will be exported into the same column. You wil

Click on this button to export the results table to sort data with Excel. The table will then be copied into an Excel document, which will open automatically. All elements produced on-line will be exported into separate columns. You will then be able to s
The list of media is displayed on screen. To select an element, click on the corresponding box. You may select one or more elements from a particular medium.

Click on MULTIMEDIA to obtain a Multimedia Product Class Analysis broken down by medium.

Click on CINEMA to obtain a Product Class Analysis with no further detail.

Click on PRESS or INTERNET to obtain a Sector-based Analysis broken down by s
You cannot deselect the categories and vehicles of a particular medium simply by clicking on it. They are selected and deselected for the medium as a whole.
You cannot deselect the vehicles of a particular sub-medium simply by clicking on it. They are selected and deselected for the sub-medium as a whole.
"Click to select one or more vehicles; only selected vehicles will be included in the set."

Click on the following link to select or deselect all the vehicles of a particular category:

The lack of a double arrow icon indicates that there is no further detail available for this element.
Click on the button to validate your current selection

The list of available categories is displayed on screen. You can select one or several categories. Check the corresponding box to select a category.
Click on the following link to select or deselect all the categories:
The list of vehicles is displayed by genre. You can select one or more elements. To select an element (Medium, Genre or Vehicle), check the appropriate box(es).
You cannot deselect the vehicles of a particular media genre simply by clicking on it. They are selected and deselected for the media genre as a whole.

For a calendar period, select (using the monthly or weekly calendar) a start date and an end date. You can access data from the last 12 months or the last 53 weeks.

to confirm the selection of your additional target.

This is a round-up of the campaign parameters.

This indicator enables you to view a calendar of all the plan's active vehicles. It is broken down by month or by week, depending on your initial specifications. You can view the calendar in greater detail (day) by clicking on the heading of the appropria
"Click on the image in the ""Creations"" column of the calendar to view details of individual ad insertions in a given vehicle."
"You can also export this analysis by insertion by clicking on the icon in the upper left area of the spreadsheet."
"From the ""analysis by insertion"" results page, click on the image in the ""Copy"" column to display the advertiser's copy of the insertion in question."
Click on the image to enlarge it.
to display the view of the vehicle at the page where the selected insertion is located.
to exit zoom mode and return to the initial calendar.
This indicator enables you to view the results of the plan broken down by title and according to the budget or GRP of the targets, as a value or a percentage.

This indicator enables you to view the share of voice of the plan in relation to the reference set (all the product groups of the set or the sum of the selected elements) according to the following variables: budget, page count, insertions and GRP of the
This indicator enables you to view the breakdown (as a value and as a %) of the investments per period according to the following variables: budget, page count, insertions and GRP of the targets.

This indicator enables you to view the breakdown (as a value and as a %) of the investments per press category according to the following variables: budget, page count, insertions and GRP of the targets.
This indicator enables you to view the relationship between each individual target and the overall 15 target, in terms of GRP and C/GRP.
This dropdown menu enables you to display your result according to all the other available variables.

"Click on this icon to open the following window and to enter a file name and an e-mail address to enable us to inform you when the PDF file is available.

The ""select an image"" option enables you to select one of the plan's available images to be ex"
to validate your choices and begin extracting the PDF file.
to cancel the PDF export request.
"Your PDF file is available on AdExpress in the ""My AdExpress"" section."

"from the ""My Downloads"" menu, you can access the list of all available PDF files.

You can then select your required file by clicking on it (link) to open and then save it to your computer.

Files are stored in My AdExpress for 7 days."

Analyse the constitution of a rival vehicle support in real time
Prepare your sales meetings and detect areas offering potential customers: product classes / advertisers / products absent from/present in a competition set

The following functions appear as a request is being constructed, as well as when a table of results is being modified. By clicking the mouse, you can access the following options:
Redefine your set: products, vehicles, date and versions:

Use this button to view the entire set of parameters for your set. It appears as soon as a dimension has been defined.
Right click to export these parameters.
To do a search, set the desired level of brand classification and enter your keyword in the indicated area (minimum 2 characters).

"There are 3 search modes :
  • A Keyword alone allows you to search for labels ""starting with.""
  • A Keyword preceded or followed by a ""*"" allows you to search for a label containing the keyword (before or after the *.)
Use this button to launch your search.
Use this button to re-initialize your search.

The search allows you to view the items found in the different hierarchical levels of the chosen branch.
The number of items found is indicated above each hierarchical level.
You can do several successive searches on different hierarchical levels in

"To select your product set you can either:
  • Exclude items. To exclude items, select them in the windows displaying your search results and click on the corresponding arrow to exclude t"

"
  • Add items. To add items, select them in the windows displaying your search results and click on the corresponding arrow to add them.
    All items selected within a single window are "

"
The button allows you to display the 2nd window of included items which will allow you to search the overlap of several product sets.
"

"
  • Choose the overlap between 2 sets. To search the overlap between two product sets from different branches, you must click on the corresponding arrows to add them separately in the 2"
You may also make combinations among the 3 possibilities. Your product set may therefore bear on included, overlapping as well as excluded items.
Use this button to deselect an item.
Use this icon to delete all the excluded or included items in your set.
Your set bears on the past 4 months and was created using the daily calendar, the calendar displayed will be detailed by day.
Your set bears on a yesterday greater than the past 4 months, the calendar displayed will be detailed by month or week according to the definition of your period.
If the campaign calendar is detailed by month or by week according to the initial definition, you may click on the header of a desired month or week to view day-by-day detail.

Use the option below to browse through the History.
You may browse by week or by month according to the detail chosen in the calendar. The period zoomed in on is highlighted in green.
